intro: Microlepia scabra, commonly known as the rough sword fern, is a species of fern belonging to the family Dryopteridaceae. It is characterized by its slender, arching fronds that are typically 30–60 cm in length. The fronds are bipinnate, with short, stiff pinnae that have a rough texture, giving the plant its common name. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in forest understories or along stream banks. The plant is native to parts of Asia, including China, Japan, and the Philippines.
